benefits.title: The research evidence base for homeopathy: a fresh assessment of the literature
benefits.summary: Homeopathy has a positive treatment effect in eight medical conditions: childhood diarrhea, fibrositis, hayfever, influenza, pain, side-effects of radio- or chemotherapy, sprains, and upper respiratory tract infection.

benefits.title: Homeopathy for anxiety and anxiety disorders: A systematic review of the research
benefits.summary: Homeopathy's evidence for anxiety and anxiety disorders is limited, but uncontrolled and observational studies report high levels of patient satisfaction and limited adverse effects.

benefits.title: Is There a Role for Homeopathy in Cancer Care? Questions and Challenges
benefits.summary: Homeopathic remedies combined with conventional care have shown to improve quality of life, reduce symptom burden, and possibly improve survival in patients with cancer.

benefits.title: Individualized Homeopathy: A Consideration of Its Relationship to Psychotherapy.
benefits.summary: Individualized homeopathy (IH) combines elements of humanistic therapy, narrative medicine, and idiographic material in treatment selection, potentially expanding its effectiveness beyond typical psychotherapy conditions.
benefits.journal: Journal of alternative and complementary medicine

benefits.title: Homeopathy in Dentistry and Oral Medicine: A review
benefits.summary: Homeopathy may be beneficial in dentistry and oral medicine due to its affordable, effective, and uplifting effects on patients.

benefits.title: Homeopathy Use in the United States and Implications for Public Health: A Review
benefits.summary: Homeopathy may play a role in improving public health, especially for conditions like upper respiratory infections and fibromyalgia.

benefits.title: Against Homeopathy – A Utilitarian Perspective
benefits.summary: Homeopathy has potential benefits such as non-invasiveness, cost-effectiveness, holism, placebo benefits, and agent autonomy, but is ethically unacceptable due to potential negative features.

benefits.title: Homeopathy as an adjunct to allopathic therapy
benefits.summary: Homeopathy treats the root of the illness, considering current and constitutional symptoms, and provides long therapy sessions for comprehensive care.

benefits.title: Homeopathy for Gastrointestinal Disorders
benefits.summary: Homeopathic treatment supports natural homeostatic mechanisms, reestablishing symbiosis between the microbiome and the immune system, lowering local and systemic inflammation, and benefiting the entire superorganism.

benefits.title: Homeopatia: um breve panorama desta especialidade médica
benefits.summary: Homeopathy provides systemic and safe treatment to patients with an optimal cost-benefit ratio.

side effects.title: The research evidence base for homeopathy: a fresh assessment of the literature
side effects.summary: Homeopathy has a positive treatment effect in eight medical conditions: childhood diarrhoea, fibrositis, hayfever, influenza, pain, side-effects of radio- or chemotherapy, sprains, and upper respiratory tract infection.

side effects.title: 'A brief history of homeopathy'.
side effects.summary: Homeopathy is effective and free of side effects that plague conventional medicine, such as harshness and side effects.
side effects.journal: Journal of the Royal Society of Medicine

side effects.title: Homeopathy: natural mind-body healing.
side effects.summary: Homeopathy is deeply healing without causing side effects, tolerance, or addiction problems.
side effects.journal: Journal of psychosocial nursing and mental health services

side effects.title: How homeopathic medicine works in cancer treatment: deep insight from clinical to experimental studies.
side effects.summary: Homeopathy has the potential to treat various types of cancers and reduce side effects caused by standard therapeutic modalities like chemotherapy, radiotherapy, or surgery.

side effects.title: Bias and adverse effects of homeopathy: is scientific criticism in homeopathy a “mission impossible”?
side effects.summary: Most components in homeopathic plant-derived mother tinctures are poisonous or toxic compounds, potentially eliciting adverse effects when administered into an organism.

side effects.title: When less is better: a comparison of Bach Flower Remedies and homeopathy.
side effects.summary: Homeopathy and Bach Flower Remedies therapy both feature highly diluted natural medicinal substances, but their safety profiles differ, and the placebo effect likely operates to a significant extent in both approaches.

side effects.title: Homeopathic Individualized Q-Potencies versus Fluoxetine for Moderate to Severe Depression: Double-Blind, Randomized Non-Inferiority Trial
side effects.summary: Individualized homeopathic Q-potencies are non-inferior to fluoxetine in treating moderate to severe depression, with no significant differences in side effects rates.
side effects.journal: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine : eCAM

side effects.title: The feasibility of a randomised, placebo-controlled clinical trial of homeopathic treatment of depression in general practice
side effects.summary: Homeopathy has few side effects and is generally associated with good compliance.

side effects.title: Homeopathic use of modern medicines: utilisation of the curative rebound effect.
side effects.summary: Homeopathy uses medicinal substances that produce effects similar to the symptoms being treated, stimulating the organism to react against its own disturbances through a vital reaction.

side effects.title: Material Risks of Homeopathic Medicinal Products: Regulatory Frameworks, Results of Preclinical Toxicology, and Clinical Meta-Analyses and Their Implications
side effects.summary: Homeopathic treatment shows no differences in the frequency of adverse reactions compared to placebo treatment, and if a risk exists, it must be so small that it has not yet been established.

dosage.title: When less is better: a comparison of Bach Flower Remedies and homeopathy.
dosage.summary: Homeopathy and Bach Flower Remedies therapy feature highly diluted natural medicinal substances, flexible dosage schedules tailored to individual patients, and energy-based healing action.

dosage.title: Laboratory Research in Homeopathy: Pro
dosage.summary: Homeopathy uses ultralow doses of highly diluted natural substances originating from plants, minerals, or animals.

dosage.title: Homeopathic Treatment of Overweight and Obesity in Pregnant Women With Mental Disorders: A Double-blind, Controlled Clinical Trial.
dosage.summary: The dosage of homeopathic treatment was 6 drops orally 2 /d, in the morning and at night, on 4 consecutive days each week.
dosage.journal: Alternative therapies in health and medicine

dosage.title: Study of the variables which influence the impregnation of globules, compressed tablets and tablet triturates used in homeopathy
dosage.summary: Globules, compressed tablets, and tablet triturates are solid dosage forms used in homeopathy.

dosage.title: Zinn, Phosphor und Mistel bei Arthrosen
dosage.summary: Homeopathy offers promising treatment options for arthrosis, using tin, phosphorus, and mistletoe.

dosage.title: A Critical Overview of Homeopathy
dosage.summary: Homeopathic remedies are diluted in a series (usually in a 1:10 or 1:100 diluentvolume ratio) and agitated or shaken between each dilution to retain biological activity.

dosage.title: Improved clinical status in fibromyalgia patients treated with individualized homeopathic remedies versus placebo.
dosage.summary: Individualized homeopathy is significantly better than placebo in lessening tender point pain and improving the quality of life and global health of persons with fibromyalgia.

dosage.title: Improving Tolerance and Compliance of New Targeted Therapies with Homeopathy: A Major Challenge in Oncology
dosage.summary: The therapeutic regimen for systematic supportive care of targeted therapies combines symptomatic diluted and dynamised homeopathic medicine, patient's constitutional homeopathic medicine, and isotherapeutic agent in 7c (10-14).

dosage.title: Homeopathic Individualized Q-Potencies versus Fluoxetine for Moderate to Severe Depression: Double-Blind, Randomized Non-Inferiority Trial
dosage.summary: Individualized homeopathic Q-potencies (Q-potencies) were non-inferior to fluoxetine in acute treatment of outpatients with moderate to severe depression.
dosage.journal: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine : eCAM

dosage.title: Homeopathic clinical case reports: Development of a supplement (HOM-CASE) to the CARE clinical case reporting guideline.
dosage.summary: The HOM-CASE guideline extension includes information on the medication, including its nomenclature, manufacture, galenic form, and dosage, to improve the quality and reliability of clinical case reports in homeopathy.
